io.atomix.catalyst.buffer

Class MappedBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.AbstractBuffer
      • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.NativeBuffer
        • io.atomix.catalyst.buffer.MappedBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, BufferInput<Buffer>, BufferOutput<Buffer>, BytesInput<Buffer>, BytesOutput<Buffer>, ReferenceCounted<Buffer>, AutoCloseable

    public class MappedBuffer
extends NativeBuffer
    Memory mapped file buffer.

    Mapped buffers provide direct access to memory from allocated by a MappedByteBuffer. Memory is allocated by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file)
        Allocates a dynamic capacity mapped buffer in FileChannel.MapMode.READ_WRITE mode with an initial capacity of 16MiB and a maximum capacity of Integer.MAX_VALUE.

        The resulting buffer will have a maximum capacity of Integer.MAX_VALUE. As bytes are written to the buffer its capacity will double in count each time the current capacity is reached. Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired capacity and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory.
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode), allocate(java.io.File, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long), allocate(java.io.File, long, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file,
                                    FileChannel.MapMode mode)
        Allocates a dynamic capacity mapped buffer in FileChannel.MapMode.READ_WRITE mode with an initial capacity of 16MiB and a maximum capacity of Integer.MAX_VALUE.

        The resulting buffer will be initialized to a capacity of 4096 and have a maximum capacity of Integer.MAX_VALUE. As bytes are written to the buffer its capacity will double in count each time the current capacity is reached. Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired capacity and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory.
        mode - The mode with which to map the file.
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File), allocate(java.io.File, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long), allocate(java.io.File, long, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file,
                                    long capacity)
        Allocates a fixed capacity mapped buffer in FileChannel.MapMode.READ_WRITE mode.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired capacity and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        The resulting buffer will have a capacity of capacity. The underlying MappedBytes will be initialized to the next power of 2.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory.
        capacity - The fixed capacity of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long), allocate(java.io.File, long, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file,
                                    FileChannel.MapMode mode,
                                    long capacity)
        Allocates a fixed capacity mapped buffer in the given FileChannel.MapMode.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired capacity and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        The resulting buffer will have a capacity of capacity. The underlying MappedBytes will be initialized to the next power of 2.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory.
        mode - The mode with which to map the file.
        capacity - The fixed capacity of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode), allocate(java.io.File, long), allocate(java.io.File, long, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file,
                                    long initialCapacity,
                                    long maxCapacity)
        Allocates a mapped buffer.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        The resulting buffer will have a capacity of initialCapacity. The underlying MappedBytes will be initialized to the next power of 2. As bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's capacity will double as long as maxCapacity > capacity.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the buffer.
        maxCapacity - The maximum capacity of the buffer.
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity or maxCapacity is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode), allocate(java.io.File, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long)

      • allocate

        public static MappedBuffer allocate(File file,
                                    FileChannel.MapMode mode,
                                    long initialCapacity,
                                    long maxCapacity)
        Allocates a mapped buffer.

        Memory will be mapped by opening and expanding the given File to the desired count and mapping the file contents into memory via FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long).

        The resulting buffer will have a capacity of initialCapacity. The underlying MappedBytes will be initialized to the next power of 2. As bytes are written to the buffer, the buffer's capacity will double as long as maxCapacity > capacity.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to map into memory. If the file doesn't exist it will be automatically created.
        mode - The mode with which to map the file.
        initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the buffer.
        maxCapacity - The maximum capacity of the buffer.
        Returns:
        The mapped buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If file is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity or maxCapacity is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        See Also:
        allocate(java.io.File), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode), allocate(java.io.File, long), allocate(java.io.File, java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long), allocate(java.io.File, long, long)

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the underlying file.
